question1: 1.1: Which are the three primary objectives of security?
1.2: Which are the three categories of controls?
1.6: Which is an efficient way to protect against an integrity attack?
1.7: Which provides you with a site where only a communication link and electricity are provided?
1.8: Which of the following is not part of the technical policies.?
1.9: Which are core goals and components of the Cisco Self-Defending Network approach? (choose 4)
1.10: Which layer of the OSI model is the current greatest target of security exploits?
1.11: Which of the following statements is false regarding security issues of custom applications?

list.A: Companies have many, perhaps hundreds, of different web applications or local databases.
list.B: Employees and contractors may have written the code without security in mind.
list.C: There are no signatures for those customized applications.
list.D: There are no patches for those customized applications.
list.E: These applications are often dynamic and complex.
list.F: Hackers cannot exploit vulnerabilities in customized software because the application is resident on the inside network.

question1: 1.12: From the following items, which does a designer not need to care about when designing network security?

list.A: The threats that could compromise security
list.B: The impact on hackers of introducing a new security policy
list.C: The associated risk of the threats
list.D: How relevant those threats are for a particular system
list.E: The cost to implement the proper security countermeasures for a threat
list.F: A cost versus benefit analysis to determine whether it is worthwhile to implement a security countermeasure

question1: 1.13: What do you call an attack in which the attacker sends a continuous stream of packets from different sources toward the same destination?
1.15: Which of the following is not a criteria on used to classify data?
1.17: Which of the following is a technical control?
1.18: Which of the following is not a characteristic of defense in depth?

list.A: Security mechanisms back each other up.
list.B: Security mechanisms do not depend on each other.
list.C: Does not require IDS or IPS.
list.D: The weakest links can be augmented so that single points of failure can be eliminated.

question1: 1.19: Match the specific man-in-the-middle attack with its specific characteristic.

list.A: Nonblind attack = Network packet sniffer required
list.B: Blind attack = Relies on routing and transport protocols to compromise target

question1: 1.22: Which of the following defines the steps that are taken when an outage occurs?
1.23: Which of the following security concepts limits a user s rights to the lowest possible level needed to perform his tasks?
1.24: Which of the following might not be a benefit of Cisco Self-Defending Networks?
1.25: Which are the three elements of threat control and containment?
2.1: What are the three areas of router security?
2.2: Which of the following is the first step to secure Cisco router administrative access?
2.3: Which two statements are true about passwords?

list.A: The console port does not require a password for console administrative access.
list.B: Passwords can not include symbols and spaces.
list.C: You can use either the enable password or the enable secret password to enter the enable mode when both are configured on a router.
list.D: The enable secret password is always hashed inside the router configuration using a MD5 hashing algorithm.

question1: 2.4: How do you interpret the following console port command: exec-timeout 3 30?

list.A: The connection closes after 3 minutes of inactivity and 30 minutes of absolute connectivity.
list.B: The connection closes after 3 minutes and 30 seconds of inactivity.
list.C: The connection closes after 3 hours of absolute connectivity and after 30 minutes of inactivity.
list.D: The connection closes after 3 hours and 30 minutes of inactivity.

question1: 2.5: What is the purpose of the 5 in the following command: username Admin secret 5 $1$feb0$a104Qd9UZ./Ak00KTggPD0?

list.A: The encrypted password will be converted to cleartext in the running-configuration using MD5.
list.B: The user Admin has privilege level 5 in this router.
list.C: The user Admin has 5 attempts to log in this router.
list.D: The encrypted-secret password was hashed with MD5.

question1: 2.6: What is the purpose of the command parser view?

list.A: It creates different views of router configuration for different users.
list.B: It provides a root view of all commands.
list.C: It configures a password for a view.
list.D: It is used to enter commands accessible for that view.

question1: 2.7: Which command would you use to enable Cisco IOS resilience?
2.8: Which of the following is not a file required in flash if you want to run Cisco SDM from that router? a. sdm.tar
2.9: Cisco SDM automatically synchronizes with the router configuration after a change?
2.10: Which SDM task would you use to configure One-Step Lockdown?
2.11: What command is used to enable AAA on a router?
2.12: Which of the following is not supported by Cisco Secure ACS?
2.13: Which portion of a RADIUS packet is sent in cleartext?

list.B: All portions except for the password
list.C: All portions except for the CHAP password
list.D: All portions except for the username

question1: 2.14: RADIUS is scheduled to be replaced by:
2.15: What is meant by “out-of-band” management?

list.A: The management traffic is sent through a control channel similar to the D channel in ISDN.
list.B: The management traffic flows within a network on which no production traffic resides.
list.C: The management traffic flows across the enterprise production network.
list.D: The management traffic hogs most of the usable bandwidth.

question1: 2.16: What is the main advantage of Cisco Security MARS over a standard syslog server?

list.D: Central repository and analysis of syslog messages

question1: 2.17: Which is an advantage of using SSH rather than Telnet to establish a management connection to a router?

list.D: SSH is readily available on all Cisco IOS routers.

question1: 2.18: Which of the following protocols is automatically enabled once RSA keys have been generated?
2.19: What is the minimum recommended key length for RSA key pairs?
2.20: What is the purpose of the crypto key zeroize rsa command?

list.A: To generate a new key pair
list.B: To establish the fully qualified domain name (FQDN)
list.C: To accept incoming connection on CON 0 and VTY 0

question1: 3.1: Which of the following is not a firewall?
3.2: Which of the following is not a limitation or an issue for a stateful firewall?

list.A: Stateful firewalls cannot prevent application layer attacks.
list.B: Stateful firewalls can provide only limited support to protocols that are not stateful.
list.C: Some applications open multiple connections and therefore are incompatible with some Stateful firewalls.
list.D: Stateful firewall cannot provide a defense against spoofing attacks.

question1: 3.4: Which threats cannot be mitigated using ACLs?
3.5: Cisco routers are certified by which of the following? Select all that apply.
3.6: Select the ACL numbers for a standard access list.
3.7: Which wildcard mask would match for IP subnets 172.30.16.0/24 to 172.30.31.0/24?
3.8: Which of the following is not an action of zone-based policy firewalls?
3.10: When using zone-based policy, for traffic to flow among all the interfaces in a router, all of the interfaces must be which of the following?

list.B: A member of a security zone
list.D: A member of a dialer interface

question1: 3.11: What is the role of class maps?

list.A: They group interfaces to which security policies will be applied.
list.B: They allow to specify a unidirectional firewall policy between two security zones.
list.C: They specify the actions to be taken when traffic matches the criteria.
list.D: They identify traffic and traffic parameters that a Cisco IOS zone-based policy firewall selects for policy application.

question1: 3.12: Finish the sentence with the most accurate statement. CBAC...

list.A: Performs traffic filtering based on application level protocol information
list.B: Uses only ACLs to control traffic
list.C: Is configured with the Cisco Common Classification Policy Language (C3PL)
list.D: Uses a hierarchical structure to define inspection for network protocols

question1: 3.13: Which of the following is an accurate access list to allow outbound traffic of guests accessing to their incoming mail server?

list.A: access-list 101 permit tcp any any eq 25
list.B: access-list 101 permit tcp any eq 25 any
list.C: access-list 101 permit tcp any eq 110 any
list.D: access-list 101 permit tcp any any eq 110

question1: 3.14: Which of the following is not a caveat regarding ACLs?

list.A: You need to use extended ACLs to implement security policies.
list.B: Beware of the implicit deny all at the bottom of ACLs.
list.C: Place more specific statements higher in ACLs.
list.D: Ensure that statements at the top of ACLs do not negate statements found lower in the list.

question1: 4.1: Asymmetric encryption utilizes which of the following?

list.A: A complex solution to leverage certificate
list.C: All types of authentication as long as they support PKI procedures
list.D: A central authority that signs public keys in a network

question1: 4.2: Select all the desirable features of an encryption algorithm.

list.B: Short lengths and scalability of the key for easy storage
list.D: Susceptible to the “avalanche effect”; a small change in plaintext causes substantial changes in ciphertext

question1: 4.3: Select all the asymmetrical algorithms.
4.4: Which of the following does not apply to cryptographic hashes?

list.A: They are based on one-way functions.
list.B: They are used for integrity assurance.
list.C: They hash arbitrary data into fixed-length digest known as a fingerprint.
list.D: It is feasible for an attacker to have two different sets of data that would come up with the same fingerprint.

question1: 4.5: DES operates in which two block cipher modes?
4.6: Which algorithm is used in AES?
4.7: Which of the following statements regarding public-key authentication is true?

list.A: When the private key is used to encrypt, the corresponding public key is used to decrypt.
list.B: Because the public key is present on only one system, authentication is assured when its private key decrypts the message.
list.C: Great effort is made to maintain the secrecy of the public keys.
list.D: Public-key scenario is used for producing fingerprint.

question1: 4.8: Which set of algorithms provides the most secure communication?
4.9: Which of the following statements best describe a digital signature?

list.A: A digital signature is a message digest encrypted with the sender’s public key.
list.B: A digital signature is a message digest encrypted with the receiver’s public key.
list.C: A digital signature is a message digest encrypted with the sender’s private key.
list.D: A digital signature is a message digest encrypted with the receiver’s public key.

question1: 4.10: Complete the sentence with the best statement: The Vigenère cipher is _______.
4.11: Which protocol encrypts at the session layer of the OSI model?
4.12: Which statement is most accurate when describing aspects of a birthday attack?

list.A: An attacker tries every possible key with the decryption algorithm.
list.B: The attacker has the ciphertext of several messages, all of which have been encrypted using the same encryption algorithm.
list.C: If some function, when supplied with a random input, returns one of k equally likely values, then by repeating the function with different inputs, the same output would be expected after 1.2k1/2 number of times.
list.D: The attacker knows a portion of the plaintext and the corresponding ciphertext.

question1: 4.13: Which statement best describes MD5?

list.A: MD5 is a one-way function that makes it difficult to compute a hash from the given input data, but makes it feasible to compute input data given only a hash.
list.B: MD5 is a one-way function that makes it easy to compute a hash from the given output data, but makes it unfeasible to compute input data given only a hash.
list.C: MD5 is a one-way function that makes it difficult to compute a hash from the given output data, but makes it feasible to compute input data given only a hash.
list.D: MD5 is a one-way function that makes it easy to compute a hash from the given input data, but makes it unfeasible to compute input data given only a hash.

question1: 5.1: Which two modes of SSL VPN are currently available with Cisco IOS?
5.2: Which of the following is not a security function provided by IPsec?
5.3: Which of the following are peer-authentication methods with IPsec?
5.4: Which three modes are used by IKE to secure communications?
5.5: Which command is better suited to show that traffic is flowing through the VPN tunnel?
5.6: Which command would help troubleshoot a Phase I issue?
5.7: Which command would be the most helpful to compare the configuration of peer, ACL, SA lifetime and transform sets?
5.8: Which of the following is not part of a cryto map configuration?
5.10: Which statement is true regarding how ESP and AH segments are encapsulated in IP packets?

list.A: In transport mode, security is provided only for the transport layer and below.
list.B: In tunnel mode, security is provided for the complete original IP packet.
list.C: In tunnel mode, security is provided only for the transport layer and above.
list.D: In transport mode, security is provided for the entire IP packet.

question1: 6.1: Which two modes of IPS operations are currently available with Cisco IDS and IPS solutions? Select all that apply.

list.A: Out-of-band b. Promiscuous c. Multicasting d. Inline

question1: 6.2: Which device cannot be an IDS or IPS sensor?

list.A: A Cisco router configured with IPS software
list.B: A Cisco VPN concentrator configured with IPS software
list.C: An appliance specifically designed to provide dedicated IDS or IPS services
list.D: A IDS/IPS network module installed in a Cisco ASA or in a switch or in a router

question1: 6.3: Which general patterns of misuse do IDS and IPS technologies look for? (Choose all that apply.)
6.4: Which of the following is not a type of IDS or IPS sensor?
6.5: What are signature engines?

list.A: A set of rules that an IDS and an IPS use to detect typical intrusive activity
list.B: A full-feature intrusion prevention located in the core network fabric device
list.C: An internal security service module that provides dedicated CPU and memory to offload intrusion prevention processing.
list.D: A component of an IDS and IPS sensor that supports a group of signatures that are in a common category

question1: 6.7: Which of the following are advantages of a network-based IPS?
6.8: Which IPS card could integrate into a Cisco 1841?
6.9: What is an IPS signature?

list.A: A message digest encrypted with the sender’s private key
list.B: A set of rules used to detect typical intrusive activity
list.C: A binary pattern specific to a virus
list.D: An appliance that provides anti-x services

question1: 6.10: Compiling a regular expression found in a signature requires more memory than the final storage of the regular expression. True or False?
7.1: A buffer overflow exploit tries to do which of the following?

list.B: Overwrite memory on the stack of an application

question1: 7.2: IronPort products provide protection against what? (Choose the three best answers.)
7.3: Which of the following are Cisco NAC Appliance characteristics? (Choose two.)

list.A: Software module embedded with NAC-enabled products
list.C: In-band solution that can be used on any Cisco switch or router
list.D: Integrated framework leveraging multiple vendor products

question1: 7.4: Define logical unit number (LUN).

list.A: A worldwide name 64-bit address that Fibre Channel networks use to uniquely identify each element in a Fibre Channel network
list.B: A collection of ports from a set of connected Fibre channel switches
list.C: An address for an individual disk drive and, by extension, the disk device itself
list.D: An I/O adapter that sits between the bus of the host computer and the Fibre Channel loop

question1: 7.5: Factors motivating the installation of a VoIP infrastructure include which of the following? (Choose three.)
7.6: Which of the following is not a valid statement regarding assigning voice traffic to specific VLANs?

list.A: To logically segment voice and data traffic to increase.
list.B: To ensure communication privacy and integrity.
list.C: It is seldom used in the industry.
list.D: It makes it easier to apply VLAN access list.

question1: 7.7: Which of the following commands should not be used on a trunk port when attempting to protect against VLAN hopping?
7.8: Which two commands best protects a switched network from a hacker who is trying to preempt an election of the Spanning Tree Protocol?
7.9: Which command limits the number of MAC addresses communicating through the same switch port?
7.10: Which feature could be used to facilitate the use of an IDS sensor on a switched network?
7.11: Which best describe the concept of least privilege?

list.A: Having small, easily verifiable pieces of software
list.B: An access control concept that refers to a mechanism that mediates all access to object
list.C: An operating system that provides isolation between processes
list.D: A process that is never given more privilege than is necessary to perform a job

question1: 7.12: Which two Cisco solutions when combined provide protection of operating system vulnerabilities?
7.13: Why should you worry about Layer 2 security?

list.A: Switches cannot regulate the flow of data between their ports.
list.B: You don’t have to worry about Layer 2 security because it is lower than the IP layer and that most attacks happen at the network layer.
list.D: VLANs are a Layer 3 function in a switch, and therefore, as with any other Layer 3 processes, it can be easily hacked.

question1: 7.15: For which reason should IP phones, VoIP gateways, and network management workstations be on their own subnet?

list.A: Many simple, yet dangerous attacks can be launched if the attacking device resides within the same broadcast domain as the target system.
list.B: Devices are easier to manage if they are located on their own subnet.
list.C: It is easier to set SSH access rules in the Cisco security appliances for a distinctive subnet.
list.D: With separate subnets, VLANs can be used to control the access to the physical network.
